description.narrative: The proposed investment would increase availability of financing to the MSME segment which lacks adequate access to finance despite being a key driver of the Indian economy. Within the SME space the transaction also intends to reach low income states and women-owned SMEs. SMEs in low income states have historically been under financed despite the region having a significant percentage of SMEs, support in this area will aid their inclusion into the formal financial system. Finally, since SMEs in India employ close to 40% of the workforce, access to credit for these entities will help them achieve scale while enhancing sector competitiveness and job creation.

table, .k-table{ border-collapse:collapse; width:100%; table-layout:fixed; margin-bottom: 15px;} .k-table, .k-table td, table, table td {outline: 0;border: 1px solid #000; } .k-table td, table td { padding: 5px; } The proposed project involves the subscription by IFC to Non-Convertible Debentures issued by Bajaj Finance Limited ("BFL", the "Company") for on-lending to micro small and medium enterprise ("MSME"). BFL is a diversified NBFC operating across different business segments - Consumer (43%), SME (42%), Commercial (12%) and Rural (3%). As of Dec 31, 2016, BFL has total assets under management of around US$ 9.23 billion and has reached out to more than 19 million customers through a widespread network branches and customer touch points.
